Generation III.Ruby: Anorith was regenerated from a prehistoric fossil. This primitive Pok é mon once lived in warm seas. It grips its prey firmly between its two large claws.
Generation III.Sapphire: Anorith is said to be a type of Pok é mon predecessor, with eight wings at the sides of its body. This Pok é mon swam in the primordial sea by undulating these eight wings.
Generation III.Emerald: It was resurrected from a fossil using the power of science. It swims by undulating the eight wings at its sides. They were feet that adapted to life in the sea.
Generation III.FireRed: It is a kind of Pok é mon progenitor. It uses its extending claws to catch prey hiding among rocks on the seafloor.
Generation III.LeafGreen: It is a kind of Pok é mon progenitor. It uses its extending claws to catch prey hiding among rocks on the seafloor.

Generation IV.Diamond: A Pokémon ancestor that was reanimated from a fossil. It lived in the sea and hunted with claws.

Generation IV.HeartGold: An ancestral Pokémon that lived in the ocean. Over time, its eight feet transformed into wings.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: An ancestral Pokémon that lived in the ocean. Over time, its eight feet transformed into wings.

Generation VI.X: It is a kind of Pokémon progenitor. It uses its extending claws to catch prey hiding among rocks on the seafloor.

Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Anorith was regenerated from a prehistoric fossil. This primitive Pokémon once lived in warm seas. It grips its prey firmly between its two large claws.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Anorith is said to be a type of Pokémon predecessor, with eight wings at the sides of its body. This Pokémon swam in the primordial sea by undulating these eight wings.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: When restored Anorith are released into the ocean, they don't thrive, because the water composition has changed since their era.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: This is one kind of primeval bug Pokémon. With eight wings, it could apparently swim a lot faster than you'd expect.

Generation VIII.Sword: This Pokémon was restored from a fossil. Anorith lived in the ocean about 100,000,000 years ago, hunting with its pair of claws.
Generation VIII.Shield: Anorith can swim swiftly by pulling its eight wings through the water like oars on a boat. This Pokémon is an ancestor of modern bug Pokémon.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: This Pokémon ancestor was reanimated from a fossil. It lived in the sea and hunted with its claws.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: This Pokémon ancestor was reanimated from a fossil. It lived in the sea and hunted with its claws.
